result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

ADDRESS INFO for Christopher R Smith
Current: 38136 N Dewey St, Spring Grove, IL 60081-9409 United States  (Effective: 04-17-2017)
Prior: 210 Burden Ave #3, Twin Lakes, WI 53181
Defendant Christopher R Smith in court with attorney jeramiah maynard.  Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Upon Motion of the State, case is dismissed and read-in. Minutes filed.

Final pre-trial on January 3, 2017 at 10:00 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on January 5, 2017 at 09:00 am.

Attorney jeramiah maynard appeared.  Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant's appearance waived by the Court.  Matter before the Court for rescheduling.. Files not joined at this time and will be back to back with 15CM401 & 15CT351. 15CM401 to be tried first.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 25, 2016 at 10:00 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for October 27, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Scheduling conference on August 17, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Christopher R Smith in court with attorney Adam John Johnson.  Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Motion deadline 08-15-16. Bond remains.  Minutes filed.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 13, 2016 at 10:00 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for September 15, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Original Warrant filed with the court.

Defendant Christopher R Smith in court with attorney Adam John Johnson.  Matthew W. Surridge appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Warrant canceled. Bond reinstated.  Minutes filed.  Status conference scheduled for May 4, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Signed bond filed with the court.

Total bond covers all files 15CM401 and 16CM76.  Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH ALPINE VALLEY, MATTHEW DEL FAVA, JAMES GARCIA, EXTERIOR HOME IMPROVEMENTS OR ITS EMPLOYEES.   Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any co-actor(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  CO-ACTOR(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH SEAN HARTMAN OR JACLYN BAILEY.   Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant Christopher R Smith in court with attorney Adam John Johnson.  Matthew W. Surridge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Status conference scheduled for May 4, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Attorney Adam John Johnson appeared.  Matthew W. Surridge appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant does not appear. Court Orders Warrant. Minutes filed.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.  Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.
